param.name: servername
param.description: show this name on the device registration

param.name: keepalive
param.description: Phone keep alive message every 60 secs. Used to check the voicemail and keep an open connection between server and phone (nat). Don\'t set any lower than 60 seconds.

param.name: debug
param.description: console debug level or categories examples: debug = 11 | debug = mwi,event,core | debug = all | debug = none or 0 possible categories: core, sccp, hint, rtp, device, line, action, channel, cli, config, feature, feature_button, softkey, indicate, pbx socket, mwi, event, adv_feature, conference, buttontemplate, speeddial, codec, realtime, lock, newcode, high, all, none

param.name: context
param.description: pbx dialplan context

param.name: dateformat
param.description: M-D-Y in any order. Use M/D/YA (for 12h format)

param.name: bindaddr
param.description: replace with the ip address of the asterisk server (RTP important param)

param.name: port
param.description: listen on port 2000 (Skinny, default)

param.name: disallow
param.description: First disallow all codecs, for example \'all\'

param.name: allow
param.description: Allow codecs in order of preference (Multiple lines allowed)

param.name: deny
param.description: Deny every address except for the only one allowed. example: \'0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0\'

param.name: permit
param.description: Accept class C 192.168.1.0 example \'192.168.1.0/255.255.255.0\' You may have multiple rules for masking traffic. Rules are processed from the first to the last. This General rule is valid for all incoming connections. It\'s the 1st filter. using \'internal\' will allow the 10.0.0.0, 172.16.0.0 and 192.168.0.0 networks

param.name: quality_over_size
param.description: When making decisions during codec selections prefer sound quality over packet size (default true)

param.name: localnet
param.description: All RFC 1918 addresses are local networks, example \'192.168.1.0/255.255.255.0\'

param.name: externip
param.description: IP Address that we\'re going to notify in RTP media stream

param.name: externhost
param.description: Hostname (if dynamic) that we\'re going to notify in RTP media stream

param.name: externrefresh
param.description: Expire time in seconds for the hostname (dns resolution)

param.name: firstdigittimeout
param.description: Dialing timeout for the 1st digit

param.name: digittimeout
param.description: More digits

param.name: digittimeoutchar
param.description: You can force the channel to dial with this char in the dialing state

param.name: recorddigittimeoutchar
param.description: You can force the channel to dial with this char in the dialing state

param.name: simulate_enbloc
param.description: Use simulated enbloc dialing to speedup connection when dialing while onhook (older phones)

param.name: autoanswer_ring_time
param.description: Ringing time in seconds for the autoanswer, the default is 1

param.name: autoanswer_tone
param.description: Autoanswer confirmation tone. For a complete list of tones: grep SKINNY_TONE sccp_protocol.h not all the tones can be played in a connected state, so you have to try.

param.name: remotehangup_tone
param.description: Passive hangup notification. 0 for none

param.name: transfer_tone
param.description: Confirmation tone on transfer. Works only between SCCP devices

param.name: callwaiting_tone
param.description: Sets to 0 to disable the callwaiting tone

param.name: callwaiting_interval
param.description: Callwaiting ring interval in seconds. Set to 0 to disable the callwaiting ringing interval (default: 0)

param.name: musicclass
param.description: Sets the default music on hold class

param.name: language
param.description: Default language setting

param.name: callevents
param.description: Generate manager events when phone Performs events (e.g. hold)

param.name: accountcode
param.description: Accountcode to ease billing

param.name: sccp_tos
param.description: Sets the default sccp signaling packets Type of Service (TOS) (defaults to 0x68 = 01101000 = 104 = DSCP:011010 = AF31) Others possible values : [CS?, AF??, EF], [0x??], [lowdelay, throughput, reliability, mincost(solaris)], none

param.name: sccp_cos
param.description: sets the default sccp signaling packets Class of Service (COS) (defaults to 4)

param.name: audio_tos
param.description: sets the default audio/rtp packets Type of Service (TOS) (defaults to 0xb8 = 10111000 = 184 = DSCP:101110 = EF)

param.name: audio_cos
param.description: sets the default audio/rtp packets Class of Service (COS) (defaults to 6)

param.name: video_tos
param.description: sets the default video/rtp packets Type of Service (TOS) (defaults to 0x88 = 10001000 = 136 = DSCP:100010 = AF41)

param.name: video_cos
param.description: sets the default video/rtp packets Class of Service (COS) (defaults to 5)

param.name: echocancel
param.description: sets the phone echocancel for all devices

param.name: silencesuppression
param.description: sets the silence suppression for all devices we don\'t have to trust the phone ip address, but the ip address of the connection

param.name: trustphoneip
param.description: The phone has a ip address. It could be private, so if the phone is behind NAT

param.name: earlyrtp
param.description: valid options: none, offhook, dial, ringout and progress. default is progress. The audio stream will be open in the progress and connected state by default.

param.name: dnd
param.description: turn on the dnd softkey for all devices. Valid values are \'off\', \'on\' (busy signal), \'reject\' (busy signal), \'silent\' (ringer = silent)

param.name: private
param.description: permit the private function softkey

param.name: mwilamp
param.description: Set the MWI lamp style when MWI active to on, off, wink, flash or blink

param.name: mwioncall
param.description: Set the MWI on call.

param.name: blindtransferindication
param.description: moh or ring. the blind transfer should ring the caller or just play music on hold

param.name: cfwdall
param.description: activate the callforward ALL stuff and softkeys

param.name: cfwdbusy
param.description: activate the callforward BUSY stuff and softkeys

param.name: cfwdnoanswer
param.description: activate the callforward NOANSWER stuff and softkeys

param.name: nat
param.description: Global NAT support (default Off)

param.name: directrtp
param.description: This option allow devices to do direct RTP sessions (default Off)

param.name: allowoverlap
param.description: Enable overlap dialing support. If enabled, starts dialing immediately and sends remaing digits as DTMF/inband. Use with extreme caution as it is very dialplan and provider dependent. (Default is off)

param.name: callgroup
param.description: We are in caller groups 1,3,4. Valid for all lines

param.name: pickupgroup
param.description: We can do call pick-p for call group 1,3,4,5. Valid for all lines

param.name: pickupmodeanswer
param.description: We can do call pick-p for call group 1,3,4,5. Valid for all lines

param.name: amaflags
param.description: Sets the default AMA flag code stored in the CDR record

param.name: protocolversion
param.description: skinny version protocol. (excluding 12-14)

param.name: callanswerorder
param.description: oldestfirst or lastestfirst

param.name: regcontext
param.description: SCCP Lines will we added to this context in asterisk for Dundi lookup purposes. Don not set to a manually created context. The context will be autocreated. You can share the sip/iax context if you like.

param.name: devicetable
param.description: datebasetable for devices

param.name: linetable
param.description: datebasetable for lines

param.name: meetme
param.description: enable/disable conferencing via meetme (on/off), make sure you have one of the meetme apps mentioned below activated in module.conf when switching meetme=on it will search for the first of these three possible meetme applications and set these defaults - {\'MeetMe\', \'qd\'}, - {\'ConfBridge\', \'Mac\'}, - {\'Konference\', \'MTV\'}

param.name: meetmeopts
param.description: options to send the meetme application, defaults are dependent on meetme app see the list above Other options (app_meetme: A,a,b,c,C,d,D,E,e,F,i,I,l,L,m,M,o,p,P,q,r,s,S,t,T,w,x,X,1) see meetme specific documentation

param.name: jbenable
param.description: Enables the use of a jitterbuffer on the receiving side of a sccp channel. Defaults to \'no\'. An enabled jitterbuffer will be used only if the sending side can create and the receiving side can not accept jitter. The sccp channel can accept jitter, thus a jitterbuffer on the receive sccp side will be used only if it is forced and enabled.

param.name: jbforce
param.description: Forces the use of a jitterbuffer on the receive side of a sccp channel. Defaults to \'no\'.

param.name: jblog
param.description: Enables jitterbuffer frame logging. Defaults to \'no\'.

param.name: jbmaxsize
param.description: Max length of the jitterbuffer in milliseconds.

param.name: jbresyncthreshold
param.description: Jump in the frame timestamps over which the jitterbuffer is resynchronized. Useful to improve the quality of the voice, with big jumps in/broken timestamps, usually sent from exotic devices and programs. Defaults to 1000.

param.name: jbimpl
param.description: Jitterbuffer implementation, used on the receiving side of a sccp channel. Two implementations are currently available - \'fixed\' (with size always equals to jbmaxsize) - \'adaptive\' (with variable size, actually the new jb of IAX2). Defaults to fixed.

param.name: hotline_enabled
param.description: Setting the hotline Feature on a device, will make it connect to a predefined extension as soon as the Receiver is picked up or the \'New Call\' Button is pressed. No number has to be given. This works even on devices which have no entry in the config file or realtime database. The hotline function can be used in different circumstances, for example at a door, where you want people to be able to only call one number, or for unprovisioned phones to only be able to call the helpdesk to get their phone set up If hotline_enabled = yes, any device which is not included in the configuration explicitly will be allowed to registered as a guest device. All such devices will register on a single shared line called \'hotline\'.

param.name: fallback
param.description: Immediately fallback to primairy/master server when it becomes available (master/slave asterisk cluster) (TokenRequest) Possible values are: true/false/odd/even (odd/even uses the last digit of the MAC address to make the decision) Value can be changed online via CLI/AMI command "fallback=[true/false]"

param.name: backoff_time
param.description: Time to wait before re-asking to fallback to primairy server (Token Reject Backoff Time)

param.name: name
param.description: device name

param.name: device
param.description: device type

param.name: devicetype
param.description: device type

param.name: type
param.description: used for device templates, value will be inherited.

param.name: description
param.description: device description

param.name: keepalive
param.description: set keepalive to 60

param.name: tzoffset
param.description: time zone offset

param.name: transfer
param.description: enable or disable the transfer capability. It does remove the transfer softkey

param.name: park
param.description: take a look to the compile how-to. Park stuff is not compiled by default

param.name: cfwdall
param.description: activate the call forward stuff and soft keys

param.name: cfwdbusy
param.description: allow call forward when line is busy

param.name: cfwdnoanswer
param.description: allow call forward when line if not being answered

param.name: dnd
param.description: parameter \'dnd\' is obsolete. This setting has moved to the line definition. To allow/disallow dnd you should use dndFeature in device and setup dnd per line.

param.name: dndFeature
param.description: allow usage do not disturb button

param.name: dtmfmode
param.description: inband or outofband. outofband is the native cisco dtmf tone play. Some phone model does not play dtmf tones while connected (bug?), so the default is inband

param.name: imageversion
param.description: useful to upgrade old firmwares (the ones that do not load *.xml from the tftp server)

param.name: deny
param.description: Same as general

param.name: permit
param.description: This device can register only using this ip address

param.name: audio_tos
param.description: sets the audio/rtp packets Type of Service (TOS) (defaults to 0xb8 = 10111000 = 184 = DSCP:101110 = EF) Others possible values : 0x??, lowdelay, throughput, reliability, mincost(solaris), none

param.name: audio_cos
param.description: sets the audio/rtp packets Class of Service (COS) (defaults to 6)

param.name: video_tos
param.description: sets the video/rtp packets Type of Service (TOS) (defaults to 0x88 = 10001000 = 136 = DSCP:100010 = AF41)

param.name: video_cos
param.description: sets the video/rtp packets Class of Service (COS) (defaults to 5)

param.name: trustphoneip
param.description: The phone has a ip address. It could be private, so if the phone is behind NAT we don\'t have to trust the phone ip address, but the ip address of the connection

param.name: nat
param.description: Device NAT support (default Off)

param.name: directrtp
param.description: This option allow devices to do direct RTP sessions (default Off)

param.name: earlyrtp
param.description: valid options: none, offhook, dial, ringout and progress. default is progress. The audio stream will be open in the progress and connected state by default.

param.name: private
param.description: permit the private function softkey for this device

param.name: privacy
param.description: permit the private function softkey for this device

param.name: mwilamp
param.description: Set the MWI lamp style when MWI active to on, off, wink, flash or blink

param.name: mwioncall
param.description: Set the MWI on call.

param.name: meetme
param.description: enable/disable conferencing via app_meetme (on/off)

param.name: meetmeopts
param.description: options to send the app_meetme application (default \'qd\' = quiet,dynamic pin) Other options (A,a,b,c,C,d,D,E,e,F,i,I,l,L,m,M,o,p,P,q,r,s,S,t,T,w,x,X,1) see app_meetme documentation

param.name: softkeyset
param.description: use specified softkeyset with name softkeyset1

param.name: pickupexten
param.description: enable Pickup function to direct pickup an extension

param.name: pickupcontext
param.description: context where direct pickup search for extensions. if not set it will be ignored.

param.name: pickupmodeanswer
param.description: on = asterisk way, the call has been answered when picked up

param.name: allowoverlap
param.description: Allow for Overlap dialing (Continue dialing after the first part of the number has already been send to the pstn)

param.name: setvar
param.description: extra variables to be set on line initialization multiple entries possible (for example the sip number to use when dialing outside) format setvar=param=value, for example setvar=sipno=12345678

param.name: permithost
param.description: permit/deny but by resolved hostname

param.name: digittimeout
param.description: More digits

param.name: allowRinginNotification
param.description: allow ringin notification for hinted extensions (Boolean, default=no). experimental configuration param that may be removed in further version

param.name: name
param.description: line name

param.name: line
param.description: line name

param.name: type
param.description: line

param.name: id
param.description: id

param.name: pin
param.description: pin

param.name: label
param.description: label

param.name: description
param.description: description

param.name: context
param.description: pbx dialing context

param.name: cid_name
param.description: callerid name

param.name: cid_num
param.description: callerid number

param.name: defaultSubscriptionId_name
param.description: Name used on a shared line when no name is specified on the line button for the device

param.name: defaultSubscriptionId_number
param.description: Number used on a shared line when no name is specified on the line button for the device

param.name: callerid
param.description: obsolete callerid param. Use cid_num and cid_name

param.name: mailbox
param.description: Mailbox to store messages in

param.name: vmnum
param.description: Number to dial to get to the users Mailbox

param.name: adhocNumber
param.description: Adhoc Number or Private-line automatic ring down (PLAR): Adhoc/PLAR circuits have statically configured endpoints and do not require the user dialing to connect calls. - The adhocNumber is dialed as soon as the Phone is taken off-hook or when the new-call button is pressed. - The number will not be dialed when choosing a line; so when you choose a line you can enter a number manually.

param.name: meetme
param.description: enable/disable conferencing via meetme, make sure you have one of the meetme apps mentioned below activated in module.conf. When switching meetme=on it will search for the first of these three possible meetme applications and set these defaults. Meetme=>\'qd\', ConfBridge=>\'Mac\', Konference=>\'MTV\'

param.name: meetmenum
param.description: This extension will receive meetme requests, SCCP_MEETME_ROOM channel variable will contain the room number dialed into simpleswitch (this parameter is going to be removed).

param.name: meetmeopts
param.description: options to send the meetme application, defaults are dependent on meetme app see the list above. Other options (app_meetme: A,a,b,c,C,d,D,E,e,F,i,I,l,L,m,M,o,p,P,q,r,s,S,t,T,w,x,X,1) see conferencing app for specific documentation

param.name: transfer
param.description: per line transfer capability

param.name: incominglimit
param.description: allow x number of incoming calls (call waiting)

param.name: echocancel
param.description: sets the phone echocancel for this line

param.name: silencesuppression
param.description: sets the silence suppression for this line

param.name: language
param.description: sets the language setting per line

param.name: musicclass
param.description: sets the music on hold class per line

param.name: accountcode
param.description: accountcode for this line to make billing per call possible

param.name: amaflags
param.description: sets the AMA flags stored in the CDR record for this line

param.name: callgroup
param.description: sets the caller groups this line is a member of

param.name: pickupgroup
param.description: sets the pickup groups this line is a member of (this phone can pickup calls from remote phones which are in this caller group

param.name: trnsfvm
param.description: extension to redirect the caller to for voice mail

param.name: secondary_dialtone_digits
param.description: digits to indicate an external line to user (secondary dialtone) (max 9 digits)

param.name: secondary_dialtone_tone
param.description: outside dialtone frequency

param.name: setvar
param.description: extra variables to be set on line initialization multiple entries possible (for example the sip number to use when dialing outside) format setvar=param=value, for example setvar=sipno=12345678

param.name: dnd
param.description: allow setting dnd for this line. Valid values are \'off\', \'on\' (busy signal), \'reject\' (busy signal), \'silent\' (ringer = silent) or user to toggle on phone

param.name: regexten
param.description: SCCP Lines will we added to the regcontext with this number for Dundi look up purpose If regexten is not filled in the line name (categoryname between []) will be used

param.name: name
param.description: softkeyset name
